tasks.task: Take a deep breath and carefully review the content provided for analysis.

Begin by identifying the main authority entities in the content: Look for people (authors, creators, subjects). Identify organizations or institutions. Note geographic locations. Identify subject terms or concepts. Look for titles of works.

For each identified authority entity: Determine its type (personal, corporate, geographic, etc.). Extract the authoritative form of its name or term. Note any variant forms (alternative names, abbreviations, etc.). Identify relationships to other entities if present. Gather any additional information (dates, affiliations, etc.).

For personal names: Separate into appropriate namePart elements (given, family, date). Extract any personal information like birth/death dates, occupation, etc. Note fields of endeavor (professional fields, areas of expertise). Identify affiliations if mentioned.

For organizational names: Determine if hierarchy exists within the name. Extract foundation/termination dates if available. Identify field of activity or purpose. Note any subordinate or related organizations.
For geographic names: Determine if the name should be represented hierarchically. Extract components (country, state, city, etc.) if applicable. Note any historical information about the location.
For topics and subjects: Identify the main concept and any qualifiers. Note any hierarchical relationships to broader or narrower terms. Extract any scope notes or definitions provided.

Begin constructing the MADS record: Create the mads root element with appropriate version attribute. Add the authority element with the authoritative form. Add variant forms in variant elements. Add related entities in related elements. Include specific info elements (personInfo, organizationInfo, etc.). Add record metadata in the recordInfo element.

Review the MADS record for completeness: Ensure all required elements are present. CRITICAL: Include ALL relevant MADS elements even if information is missing - use empty tags or placeholder values rather than omitting elements. For elements where no information was found, include the element with empty content (e.g., <namePart type="date"/>) or a placeholder value. Verify correct use of attributes and namespace declarations. Check that relationships are properly expressed. Confirm that all extracted information is represented.
Format the final MADS XML record according to the specifications in the mads_format.xml file.
